Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a dark-red pottery jar for storing a dry commodity, the fabric is grey/black in section, the interior is slightly grooved, with the remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Amarna, el-, TA:26/44 Panehsy's House
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3:219, pl.XCVII no.328
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393454) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393454)
